title: High Public Sector Transparency
description: In 2023, Cape Verde achieved a CPIA transparency, accountability, and corruption rating of 4.5 out of 6, indicating a relatively high level of transparency in the public sector.

title: Quality Public Administration
description: The CPIA quality of public administration rating for Cape Verde was 4 out of 6 in 2023, reflecting a competent public administration system.

title: Minimal Ores and Metals Exports
description: In 2023, ores and metals accounted for only 0.000058% of Cape Verde's merchandise exports, highlighting a limited reliance on these sectors.

title: Low Cereal Yield
description: Cape Verde's cereal yield was 11.5 kg per hectare in 2022, one of the lowest globally, indicating challenges in agricultural productivity.

title: Minimal Patent Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2021, Cape Verde had only 1 patent application by nonresidents, suggesting limited foreign interest in intellectual property within the country.

title: High Coal Rents Contribution to GDP
description: Coal rents contributed 17.18% to Cape Verde's GDP in 2021, indicating a significant reliance on coal-related revenues.

title: Children Living with HIV
description: In 2022, there were 100 children aged 0-14 living with HIV in Cape Verde, highlighting ongoing public health challenges.
